longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: An Ordinance to make provisions for the prevention and suppression of acts of violence against civil air transport and for connected purposes.

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Aviation Security Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—

def.name: ActOfViolence
def.leadIn: act of violence (暴力行為) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any act done in Hong Kong which constitutes the offence of murder, attempted murder, manslaughter, culpable homicide or assault, or an offence under section 17, 19, 20, 21, 22, 23, 28 or 29 of the Offences against the Person Ordinance (Cap. 212) or under section 53 or 54 of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any act done outside Hong Kong which, if done in Hong Kong, would constitute an offence mentioned in paragraph (a);

subsection.def: aerodrome (機場) means any area of land or water in Hong Kong designed, equipped, set apart or commonly used for affording facilities for the landing and taking off of aircraft and area of land and water includes any area of space, whether on the ground, on the roof of a building or elsewhere, which is designed, equipped or set apart for affording facilities for the landing and taking off of aircraft capable of descending or climbing vertically;

air navigation installation (航空導航裝置) means any building, works, apparatus or equipment used wholly or mainly for the purpose of assisting air traffic control or as an aid to air navigation, together with any land adjacent to any such building, works, apparatus or equipment and used wholly or mainly for purposes connected therewith;
aircraft (飛機) means any aircraft other than an aircraft in military, customs or police service;
Airport Authority (機場管理局) means the Airport Authority established by the Airport Authority Ordinance (Cap. 483);
authorized officer (獲授權人員) means an authorized officer appointed under section 63;

commander (機長), in relation to an aircraft, means the member of the crew designated as commander of that aircraft by the operator of the aircraft, or, where no such person is designated, the person who is for the time being in charge of the piloting of the aircraft without being under the direction of any other pilot in the aircraft;

country or territory to which the Tokyo Convention applies (《東京公約》適用的國家或地區) means a country or territory in which the Convention on Offences and certain other Acts Committed on board Aircraft signed at Tokyo on 14 September 1963 is for the time being in force and which is specified in Schedule 1;
Director (處長) means the Director-General of Civil Aviation; (Amended L.N. 326 of 2000)
enforcement notice (強制執行通知) means an enforcement notice served under section 46;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: manufactured for the purpose of producing a practical effect of explosion;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: manufactured or adapted (whether in the form of a bomb, grenade or otherwise) so as to have the appearance of being an explosive, whether it is capable of producing a practical effect of explosion or not; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: marked or labelled so as to indicate that it is or contains an explosive;

subsection.def: firearm (火器) has the same meaning as in the Firearms and Ammunitions Ordinance (Cap. 238);

def.name: HongKongcontrolledAircraft
def.leadIn: Hong Kong-controlled aircraft (香港控制的飛機) means an aircraft—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which is for the time being registered in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: which, being for the time being registered outside Hong Kong, is for the time being chartered by demise to a person who, or to persons each of whom—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is a person qualified to be the owner of a legal or beneficial interest in an aircraft registered in Hong Kong; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: resides or has his principal place of business in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: which is not for the time being registered in any place but in the case of which either the operator of the aircraft or each person entitled as owner to any legal or beneficial interest in it—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is a person qualified to be the owner of a legal or beneficial interest in an aircraft registered in Hong Kong; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: resides or has his principal place of business in Hong Kong;

subsection.def: Hong Kong permanent resident (香港永久性居民) has the same meaning as in the Immigration Ordinance (Cap. 115);
immigration officer (入境事務人員) means any member of the Immigration Service;

measures (措施) includes the construction, execution, alteration, demolition or removal of buildings or other works and also includes the institution or modification, and the supervision and enforcement, of any practice or procedure;
non-Hong Kong-controlled aircraft (非香港控制的飛機) means an aircraft other than a Hong Kong-controlled aircraft; (Added 14 of 2005 s. 2)
operator (營運者), in relation to an aircraft, means the person who for the time being has the management or control of the aircraft; (Amended 14 of 2005 s. 9)
Programme (《計劃》) means the Aviation Security Programme drawn up under section 27(1);
qualification (資格), in relation to a person, includes training and experience;
relevant offence (有關罪行) means an offence under section 8, 9, 11, 12 or 15;
restricted area (禁區) means a restricted area designated under section 35;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any explosive;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: any article having the appearance of being a firearm, whether capable of being discharged or not;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: any poisonous or noxious substance that may cause death or serious bodily harm;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any dangerous goods within the meaning of the Dangerous Goods (Consignment by Air) (Safety) Ordinance (Cap. 384); or

paragraph.name: g

subsection.def: security direction (保安指示) means a security direction issued under section 28(1);
The Hague Convention (《海牙公約》) means the Convention for the Suppression of Unlawful Seizure of Aircraft signed at The Hague on 16 December 1970;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to the commission of an act in Hong Kong, means so as (apart from this Ordinance) to constitute an offence under the law of Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to the commission of an act outside Hong Kong, means so that the commission of the act would (apart from this Ordinance) have been an offence under the law of Hong Kong if it had been committed in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the period during which an aircraft is in flight shall be deemed to include—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: if the aircraft makes a forced landing, any period after the landing until the time when competent authorities of the country or territory in which the forced landing takes place take over the responsibility for the aircraft and for the persons and property on board the aircraft (being if the forced landing takes place in Hong Kong, the time when a police officer arrives at the place of landing); and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any period when it is on the surface of the sea or land but not within the territorial limits of any country or territory;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an aircraft shall be taken to be in service during the whole of the period which begins with the pre-flight preparation of the aircraft for a flight and ends 24 hours after the aircraft lands having completed that flight, and also at any time (not falling within that period) while, in accordance with paragraph (a), the aircraft is in flight; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any act done on board an aircraft while in flight over Hong Kong shall be treated as done in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in the case of any other air navigation installation, the manager of an aerodrome by whom it is provided, or by whom it is wholly or mainly used,

subsection.continued: shall be taken to be the authority responsible for that air navigation installation.

subsection.content: In any proceedings, a certificate purporting to be signed by the Central People’s Government that an aircraft is or is not a military aircraft for the purposes of this Ordinance shall be conclusive evidence of that fact. (Amended 2 of 2012 s. 3)

References in this Ordinance to any country or territory or the territorial limits of any country or territory shall be construed as including a reference to the waters, if any, under the jurisdiction of that country or territory, as the case may be.

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority by order published in the Gazette declares—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that any 2 or more countries or territories specified in the order have established an organization or agency which operates aircraft; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that one of those countries or territories has been designated as exercising for aircraft so operated, the powers of the country or territory of registration,

subsection.continued: the state declared to have been so designated shall be deemed for the purpose of this Ordinance to be the country or territory in which any aircraft so operated is registered.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application of criminal law to aircraft

subsection.content: Any act or omission taking place on board a Hong Kong-controlled aircraft while in flight elsewhere than in or over Hong Kong which, if taking place in Hong Kong, would constitute an offence under the law of Hong Kong shall constitute that offence.
Subsection (1) shall not apply to any act or omission which is expressly or impliedly authorized by or under the law of Hong Kong when taking place outside Hong Kong.

No proceedings for any offence under the law of Hong Kong committed on board an aircraft while in flight elsewhere than in or over Hong Kong shall be instituted except by or with the consent of the Secretary for Justice, but this subsection shall not prevent the arrest, or the issue of a warrant for the arrest, of any person in respect of any offence, or the remanding in custody or on bail of any person charged with any offence. (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)
The provisions of subsections (2) to (5) have effect for the purposes of any proceedings before any court in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: If the commander of an aircraft in flight, wherever the aircraft may be, has reasonable grounds to believe that a person on board the aircraft—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: has done or is about to do any act on the aircraft while it is in flight which jeopardises or may jeopardise—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the safety of the aircraft or of persons or property on board the aircraft; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: good order and discipline on board the aircraft; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has done on the aircraft while in flight any act which in the opinion of the commander is a serious offence under any law in force in the country or territory in which the aircraft is registered, not being a law of a political nature or based on any form of discrimination as to race, colour, sex, language, religion, political or other opinion or national or social origin,

subsection.continued: then, subject to subsection (4), the commander may take with respect to that person such reasonable measures, including restraint of his person, as may be necessary—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: to protect the safety of the aircraft or of persons or property on board the aircraft;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: to maintain good order and discipline on board the aircraft; or

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: to enable the commander to disembark or deliver that person in accordance with subsection (5),

subsection.continued: and for the purposes of paragraph (b) any Hong Kong-controlled aircraft shall be deemed to be registered in Hong Kong whether or not it is in fact so registered.

subsection.content: Any member of the crew of an aircraft and any other person on board the aircraft may, at the request or with the authority of the commander of the aircraft, and any such member shall if so required by that commander, render assistance in restraining any person whom the commander is entitled under subsection (2) to restrain; and at any time when the aircraft is in flight any such member or other person may, without obtaining the authority of the commander, take with respect to any person on board the aircraft any measures such as are mentioned in that subsection which he has reasonable grounds to believe are immediately necessary to protect the safety of the aircraft or of persons or property on board the aircraft.

subsection.leadIn: Any restraint imposed on any person on board an aircraft under the powers conferred by this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall not be continued after the time when the aircraft first thereafter ceases to be in flight unless before or as soon as is reasonably practicable after that time the commander of the aircraft causes notification of the fact that a person on board the aircraft is under restraint and of the reasons therefor to be sent to a competent authority of the place in which the aircraft so ceases to be in flight having functions corresponding to those of the Hong Kong Police Force; but (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: may, subject to such notification, be continued after that time—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for any period (including the period of any further flight) between that time and the first occasion thereafter on which the commander is able with any requisite consent of the competent authorities to disembark or deliver the person under restraint in accordance with subsection (5); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the person under restraint agrees to continue his journey under restraint on board that aircraft.

subsection.leadIn: The commander of an aircraft—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if in the case of any person on board the aircraft he has reasonable grounds—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to believe as mentioned in subsection (2)(a); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to believe that it is necessary so to do in order to protect the safety of the aircraft or of persons or property on board the aircraft or to maintain good order and discipline on board the aircraft,

paragraph.continued: may disembark that person in any place in which that aircraft may be; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if in the case of any person on board the aircraft he has reasonable grounds to believe as mentioned in subsection (2)(b), may deliver that person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in Hong Kong, to a police officer; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in any other country or territory to which the Tokyo Convention applies to a public officer having functions corresponding to those of a police officer or an immigration officer.

subsection.leadIn: The commander of an aircraft—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if he disembarks any person in pursuance of subsection (5)(a), in the case of a Hong Kong-controlled aircraft, in any place or, in the case of any other aircraft, in Hong Kong, shall report the fact of, and the reasons for, that disembarkation to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a competent authority in the place of disembarkation; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the appropriate diplomatic or consular office of the country of nationality of that person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if he intends to deliver any person in accordance with subsection (5)(b) in Hong Kong or, in the case of a Hong Kong-controlled aircraft, in any other country or territory to which the Tokyo Convention applies, shall before or as soon as reasonably practicable after landing give notification of his intention and of the reasons therefor—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the place in question is Hong Kong, to a police officer or immigration officer or, in the case of any other country or territory to which the Tokyo Convention applies, to a public officer having functions corresponding to those of a police officer or an immigration officer; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in either case to the appropriate diplomatic or consular office of the country of nationality of that person,

subsection.continued: and any commander of an aircraft who without reasonable excuse fails to comply with the requirements of this subsection commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Piracy
section.content: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that for the purposes of any proceedings before a court in Hong Kong in respect of piracy, the provisions set out in Schedule 2 shall be treated as constituting part of the law of nations and any court in Hong Kong having jurisdiction in respect of piracy committed on the high seas shall have jurisdiction in respect of piracy committed by or against an aircraft wherever that piracy is committed.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Provisions as to evidence in connection with aircraft

subsection.leadIn: Where in any proceedings before a court in Hong Kong for an offence committed on board an aircraft the testimony of any person is required and the court is satisfied that the person cannot be found in Hong Kong, there shall be admissible in evidence before that court any deposition relating to the subject matter of those proceedings previously made on oath by that person outside Hong Kong which was so made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the presence of the person charged with the offence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: before a judge or magistrate of a country or a consular officer of the country of nationality of the deponent.

subsection.content: Any such deposition shall be authenticated by the signature of the judge, magistrate or consular officer before whom it was made who shall certify that the person charged with the offence was present at the taking of the deposition.

It shall not be necessary in any proceedings to prove the signature or official character of the person appearing so to have authenticated any such deposition or to have given such a certificate, and such a certificate shall, unless the contrary is shown, be sufficient evidence in any proceedings that the person charged with the offence was present at the making of the deposition.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: deposition (供詞) includes any affidavit, affirmation, declaration or statement made upon oath;
oath (宣誓) includes an affirmation or declaration in the case of persons allowed by law to affirm or declare instead of swearing.

subsection.content: Nothing in this section shall prejudice the admission as evidence of any deposition which is admissible in evidence apart from this section.

In any proceedings a document purporting to be certified by such authority or person as may be designated for the purpose of this subsection by the Chief Executive in Council by regulation made under section 53(1) as being, or being a true copy of, or of part of, a document or record so designated shall be evidence of the matters appearing from that document.

subsection.leadIn: In any proceedings under this Ordinance any record made by such authority or person as may be designated for the purpose of this subsection by the Chief Executive in Council by regulation made under section 53(1), or by a person under the control of such authority or person, being a record purporting to show—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the position of any aircraft at any material time; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the terms or content of any message or signal transmitted to any aircraft, either alone or in common with other aircraft, or received from any aircraft, by the first-mentioned authority or person, or by a person acting under the control of that authority or person,

subsection.continued: shall, if produced from the custody of that authority or person, be evidence of the matters appearing from the record.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Offences against the Safety of Aircraft etc.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), a person on board an aircraft in flight who unlawfully, by the use of force or by threats of any kind, seizes the aircraft or exercises control of it, commits the offence of hijacking, whatever the country or territory in which the aircraft is registered and whether the aircraft is in Hong Kong or elsewhere.

subsection.leadIn: If both the place of take-off and the place of landing are within the territorial limit of the country or territory in which the aircraft is registered, subsection (1) shall not apply unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person seizing or exercising control of the aircraft is a Hong Kong permanent resident;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: his act is committed in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the aircraft is registered in Hong Kong.

subsection.content: A person who commits the offence of hijacking is liable on conviction on indictment to imprisonment for life.

subsection.leadIn: If the Chief Executive in Council by order declares— (Amended 71 of 1999 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that any 2 or more countries or territories named in the order have established an organization or agency which operates aircraft; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that one of those countries or territories has been designated as exercising, for aircraft so operated, the powers of the country or territory of registration,

subsection.continued: the country or territory declared under paragraph (b) shall be deemed for the purposes of this section to be the country or territory in which any aircraft so operated is registered; but in relation to such an aircraft subsection (2) shall have effect as if it referred to the territorial limit of any one of the countries or territories named in the order.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Destroying, damaging or endangering safety of aircraft

subsection.leadIn: Any person who unlawfully and intentionally—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: destroys an aircraft in service or so damages such an aircraft as to render it incapable of flight or as to be likely to endanger its safety in flight; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: commits on board an aircraft in flight any act of violence which is likely to endanger the safety of the aircraft,

subsection.continued: commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who unlawfully and intentionally places, or causes to be placed, on an aircraft in service any article, device or substance which is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: likely to destroy the aircraft; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: likely so to damage it as to render it incapable of flight or as to be likely to endanger its safety in flight,

subsection.continued: commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in subsection (2) shall be construed as limiting the circumstances in which the commission of any act—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may constitute an offence under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may constitute attempting or conspiring to commit, or aiding, abetting, counselling or procuring the commission of such an offence.

subsection.content: Subsections (1) and (2) apply whether any act mentioned in those subsections is committed in Hong Kong or elsewhere and whatever the country or territory in which the aircraft is registered.
A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) or (2) is liable on conviction on indictment to imprisonment for life.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Offences in relation to certain dangerous articles

subsection.leadIn: Any person who, without lawful authority or excuse, has with him—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on any aircraft registered in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on any other aircraft at a time when it is in, or in flight over, Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in any part of an aerodrome; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in any air navigation installation in Hong Kong which does not form part of an aerodrome,

subsection.continued: any restricted article commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section a person who is for the time being in an aircraft, or in part of an aerodrome, shall be treated as having with him in the aircraft, or in that part of the aerodrome, as the case may be, a restricted article if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: where he is on an aircraft, the article is in the aircraft and has been—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: caused by him to be brought there as being, or as forming part of, any other property to be carried on such a flight; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where he is in part of an aerodrome (otherwise than in an aircraft), the article, or an article in which it is contained, is in that or any other part of the aerodrome and has been—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: caused (whether by him or by any other person) to be brought into the aerodrome as being, or as forming part of, his baggage on a flight from that aerodrome; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: caused by him to be brought there as being, or as forming part of, any other property to be carried on such a flight on which he is also to be carried,

paragraph.continued: notwithstanding that the circumstances may be such that (apart from this subsection) he would not be regarded as having the article with him in the aircraft or in a part of the aerodrome, as the case may be.

subsection.content: Nothing in subsection (2) shall be construed as limiting the circumstances in which a person would, apart from that subsection, be regarded as having an article with him as mentioned in subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: A person guilty of an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 5 years.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Other acts endangering or likely to endanger safety of aircraft

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (5) and (6), it is an offence for any person unlawfully and intentionally to destroy or damage any property to which this subsection applies, or to interfere with the operation of any such property, where the destruction, damage or interference is likely to endanger the safety of aircraft in flight.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) applies to any property used for the provision of air navigation facilities, including—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any land, building or ship so used; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any apparatus or equipment so used, whether it is on board an aircraft or elsewhere.

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (4) and (5), it is an offence for any person to intentionally to communicate any information which is false, misleading or deceptive in a material particular, if the communication of the information endangers the safety of an aircraft in flight or is likely to endanger the safety of aircraft in flight.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (3) to prove—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that he believed, and had reasonable grounds for believing, that the information was true; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that, when he communicated the information, he was lawfully employed to perform duties which consisted of or included the communication of information and that he communicated the information in good faith in the performance of those duties.

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (1) and (3) do not apply to the commission of any act unless either the act is committed in Hong Kong, or, where it is committed outside Hong Kong—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person committing it is a Hong Kong permanent resident;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the act endangers or is likely to endanger the safety in flight of a Hong Kong-controlled aircraft; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the act is committed on board an aircraft which lands in Hong Kong with the person who committed the act still on board.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) also does not apply to any act committed outside Hong Kong in relation to property which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is situated outside Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not used for the provision of air navigation facilities in connection with international air navigation,

subsection.continued: unless the person committing the act is a Hong Kong permanent resident.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) or (3) is liable, on conviction on indictment, to imprisonment for life.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Acts of violence committed during hijacking or attempted hijacking, etc.

subsection.content: Without prejudice to section 3, 9(1)(b) or 12A, where a person does on board any aircraft (wherever registered) and while outside Hong Kong any act which if done in Hong Kong would constitute the offence of murder, attempted murder, manslaughter, culpable homicide or assault or an offence under section 17, 19, 20, 21, 22, 23, 28 or 29 of the Offences against the Person Ordinance (Cap. 212) or under section 53 or 54 of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200), the act shall constitute that offence if it is done in connection with an offence of hijacking committed or attempted by that person on board that aircraft. (Amended 14 of 2005 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: It is an offence for any person in Hong Kong to induce or assist in the commission outside Hong Kong of any act which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: would, but for section 8(2), be an offence under that section; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: would, but for section 11(5) or (6), be an offence under that section. (Amended E.R. 6 of 2019)

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (2) is liable, on conviction on indictment, to imprisonment for life.
Subsection (2) has effect without prejudice to the operation, in relation to any offence under section 8 or 11, of any law relating to accessories.

section.name: s12A
section.heading: Acts of violence, threats, destruction of property, etc., in general

subsection.content: Without prejudice to section 3, 9(1)(b) or 12 but subject to section 12C, where a person does on board any aircraft (wherever registered) and while outside Hong Kong any act which if done in Hong Kong would constitute an offence under section 17(a), 19, 39 or 40 of the Offences against the Person Ordinance (Cap. 212) or section 24, 60, 118, 118A, 122, 146 or 148 of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200), the act shall constitute that offence.

For the avoidance of doubt, the references to “public place” and “the public” in section 148(1) of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200) shall, for the purposes of subsection (1), be deemed to include an aircraft and the passengers and crew of an aircraft, respectively.

section.name: s12B
section.heading: Offences in relation to unruly behaviour, etc.

subsection.content: Any person on board an aircraft who wilfully obstructs a member of the crew of the aircraft in the performance of his duties commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: Any person on board an aircraft who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with any instruction given to the person by the commander of the aircraft, or on behalf of the commander by a member of the crew, for the purpose of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: protecting the safety of the aircraft or of persons or property on board the aircraft; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: maintaining good order and discipline on board the aircraft,

subsection.continued: commits an offence.

subsection.content: Any person on board an aircraft who behaves in a disorderly manner whereby the good order or discipline on board the aircraft is or is likely to be jeopardised commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: Any person on board an aircraft who wilfully tampers or interferes with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any component of the aircraft;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any apparatus or equipment of the aircraft (including, but not limited to, smoke detectors); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any system installed in the aircraft,

subsection.continued: commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who, without reasonable excuse, embarks on an aircraft in such a state of intoxication, or becomes intoxicated on board an aircraft to such an extent, as to jeopardise or be likely to jeopardise—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the safety of the aircraft or of persons or property on board the aircraft; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: good order and discipline on board the aircraft,

subsection.continued: commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: Any person on board an aircraft who smokes in the aircraft or in any compartment of the aircraft—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: when smoking in the aircraft, or in that compartment of the aircraft, as the case may be, is prohibited; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: when instructed not to smoke by a member of the crew of the aircraft,

subsection.continued: commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: Any person on board an aircraft who operates an electronic device in the aircraft or in any compartment of the aircraft—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: when operating such a device in the aircraft, or in that compartment of the aircraft, as the case may be, is prohibited; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: when instructed not to operate the device by a member of the crew of the aircraft,

subsection.continued: commits an offence.

subsection.content: Subject to section 12C, subsections (1), (2), (3), (4), (5), (6) and (7) apply whether any act mentioned in those subsections is committed in Hong Kong or elsewhere and whatever the country or territory in which the aircraft is registered.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) or (2) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 year;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 5 years.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (3), (4), (5), (6) or (7) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (6) but without limiting the generality of that subsection, smoking in an aircraft or in a compartment of an aircraft shall be treated as prohibited if passenger information signs on board the aircraft indicate that smoking in the aircraft or in that compartment of the aircraft, as the case may be, is prohibited.

For the purposes of subsection (7) but without limiting the generality of that subsection, operating an electronic device in an aircraft or in a compartment of an aircraft shall be treated as prohibited if passenger information signs on board the aircraft indicate that the operation of such a device in the aircraft or in that compartment of the aircraft, as the case may be, is prohibited.

subsection.def: In subsection (5), state of intoxication (神智不清的狀態) and intoxicated (神智不清) mean being under the influence of alcohol, drugs or other intoxicating substances.

subsection.leadIn: Sections 12A and 12B do not apply to an act committed by any person on board a non-Hong Kong-controlled aircraft while in flight elsewhere than in or over Hong Kong unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the next place of landing of the aircraft is in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the commander of the aircraft, in the form set out in Schedule 3—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: makes a request to the Hong Kong Police Force to commence proceedings against the person; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: gives an undertaking that he, and the operator of the aircraft, has not made and will not make a similar request to the authorities of any place outside Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: A request and undertaking by a commander of an aircraft in the form set out in Schedule 3 shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be admissible in evidence in any proceedings before a court in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the absence of evidence to the contrary, be sufficient evidence of the matters stated in the form.

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, a person in respect of whom a request is made in the form set out in Schedule 3 may be charged with or convicted of any offence under the law of Hong Kong for which he may be liable, notwithstanding that the offence is not stated in that form to have been suspected to have been committed.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Powers exercisable on suspicion of intended offences

subsection.leadIn: Where an employee of an operator of an aircraft, a person authorized in that behalf by such operator, the manager of an aerodrome, a person authorized in that behalf by such manager, a police officer or any other public officer has reasonable grounds to suspect that a person about to embark on an aircraft in Hong Kong or a person on board such an aircraft intends to commit, in relation to the aircraft, an offence under section 8, 9, 11, 12, 12A or 12B, the employee, manager, person or officer may prohibit such person from travelling on board the aircraft, and for the purpose of enforcing that prohibition the employee or officer— (Amended 14 of 2005 s. 5)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may prevent the person from boarding the aircraft or, as the case may be, remove the person from the aircraft; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: may arrest the person without warrant and—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: detain the person for so long as may be necessary for that purpose; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: (if the person making the arrest is not himself a police officer) shall deliver the person so arrested to a police officer as soon as reasonably practicable.

subsection.leadIn: A person who wilfully obstructs any person acting in the exercise of a power conferred by subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 2;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) has effect without prejudice to the operation in relation to any offence under this Ordinance of any law relating to the power to arrest without warrant.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Prosecution of offences
section.content: Proceedings for a relevant offence shall not be instituted except by or with the consent of the Secretary for Justice.

part.name: P4
part.heading: Unlawful Acts against Safety at Aerodromes

subsection.leadIn: It is an offence for any person to commit, whether by means of any device, substance or weapon or otherwise, wilfully in an aerodrome serving international civil aviation any act of violence which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: causes or is likely to cause death or serious personal injury; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: endangers or is likely to endanger the safe operation of the aerodrome or the safety of persons in the aerodrome.

subsection.leadIn: It is an offence for any person by means of any device, substance, weapon or otherwise unlawfully and wilfully—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to destroy or seriously to damage—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: property used for the provision of any facilities in an aerodrome serving international civil aviation (including any apparatus or equipment so used); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any aircraft which is in such an aerodrome but is not in service; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to disrupt the services of such an aerodrome,

subsection.continued: in such a way as to endanger or be likely to endanger the safe operation of the aerodrome or the safety of persons in the aerodrome.

subsection.content: Subsections (1) and (2) apply whether any such act as is referred to in those subsections is committed in Hong Kong or elsewhere.
A person who commits an offence under this section is liable on conviction on indictment to imprisonment for life.

subsection.def: In this section, aerodrome (機場) includes any area of land or water outside Hong Kong which would have fallen within the definition of aerodrome in section 2(1) if it was in Hong Kong.(Amended E.R. 6 of 2019)

section.name: s16
section.heading: False statements relating to baggage, cargo etc.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who, in answer to a question which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: relates to any baggage, cargo or stores (whether belonging to him or to another) that is or are intended for carriage by an aircraft registered or operating in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: is put to him for the purposes to which Part VIII applies—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by any of the persons to whom subsection (2) applies;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by any employee or agent of such a person in his capacity as employee or agent; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: by a police officer,

subsection.continued: makes a statement which he knows to be false or misleading in a material particular, or recklessly makes a statement which is false or misleading in a material particular commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the manager of an aerodrome;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the operator of an aircraft registered or operating in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: any person who—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is permitted to have access to a restricted area in an aerodrome for the purposes of the business carried on by him; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has control in that restricted area over the baggage, cargo or stores to which the question relates.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: cargo (貨物) includes mail;
stores (物料) means goods intended for sale or use in the restricted zone, including spare parts and other articles of equipment, whether or not for immediate fitting.

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: get onto an aircraft in an aerodrome except with the permission of the operator of the aircraft or a person acting on his behalf; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: remain on such an aircraft after being requested to leave by the operator of the aircraft or a person acting on his behalf.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) without reasonable excuse commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Extraterritorial application of sections 8, 9, 11, 12, 12A, 12B and 15
section.content: Where an act constitutes an offence by virtue of section 8, 9, 11, 12, 12A, 12B or 15 and proceedings are taken for the offence and the court in which the proceedings are brought has not, apart from this section, jurisdiction to hear and determine the proceedings, then for the purpose of conferring such jurisdiction the act shall be treated as having occurred in Hong Kong.

part.name: P6
part.heading: Aviation Security Authority and Aviation Security Committee

subsection.content: The Chief Executive shall appoint a public officer to be the Aviation Security Authority for the purposes of this Ordinance. (Amended 71 of 1999 s. 3)
Any appointment made under subsection (1) shall be published in the Gazette.
The function of the Authority is to develop, maintain and implement the Programme.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (1), the Authority shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: supervise compliance with the provisions of this Part; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: advise persons affected by the implementation of the Programme.

subsection.content: The Chief Executive may give directions in writing either generally or in a particular case in relation to the exercise of any of the powers or performance of any of the functions conferred or imposed on the Authority under this Ordinance. (Amended 71 of 1999 s. 3)
The Authority shall comply with any direction given under subsection (1).

Subject to subsections (2) and (3), the Authority may, in writing, delegate to any public officer, either generally or for any particular purpose and either by name or by reference to an office or post, such of his powers and functions under this Ordinance as he thinks fit.
No delegation made under subsection (1) shall preclude the Authority from exercising or performing at any time of the powers or functions so delegated.
The Authority shall not delegate any power conferred on him by sections 53(2) and 54.
There is hereby established a committee by the name of the “Aviation Security Committee”. (Amended E.R. 6 of 2019)

subsection.leadIn: The functions of the Committee are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to advise the Authority upon—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any matter relevant to the development, maintenance and implementation of the Programme; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: such other matters relating to aviation security as the Chief Executive or the Authority may refer to the Committee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such other functions related to aviation security as the Chief Executive may from time to time direct. (Amended 71 of 1999 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: The Committee shall consist of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority or a representative nominated by him, who shall be the Chairman (Chairman);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director or a representative nominated by him;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Commissioner of Police or a representative nominated by him;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: such number of public officers as the Authority thinks fit appointed by the Authority; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: such number of other persons, not being public officers, as the Authority thinks fit appointed by the Authority.

subsection.content: Appointment under subsection (3)(d) may be made by reference to an office or post and where such an appointment is made, the individual who is for the time being occupying the office or post or who is discharging the functions of that office or post shall be the member so appointed.
The members appointed under subsection (3)(d) and (e) shall hold office for such period and upon such terms as the Authority may specify in their respective appointments.
A member of the Committee appointed under subsection (3)(e) may resign at any time by notice in writing delivered to the Authority.
The Committee shall meet as often as the Chairman may determine to be necessary for the consideration of any matters referred to in subsection (2).
The procedure of the Committee shall be determined by the Committee.

subsection.leadIn: The Committee may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: establish such sub-committees as the Committee sees fit to assist the Committee in the discharge of its functions;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: appoint such persons as the Committee sees fit as members of any such sub-committee; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: consult with such other persons as the Committee sees fit.

part.name: P7
part.heading: Aviation Security Programme and the Authority’s Power to Give Direction

subsection.content: The Authority shall, with the advice of the Committee, draw up an Aviation Security Programme to provide for the protection and safeguarding of aircraft including passengers and crew operating in and through Hong Kong, of the facilities of aerodromes serving international civil aviation and of the ground personnel and the general public within such aerodromes against interferences which constitute an offence under this Ordinance or any other law.

subsection.leadIn: The Programme may include a security programme which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: applies to a particular aerodrome;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: applies to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an operator of an aircraft registered or operating in Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a person who occupies any land forming part of an aerodrome; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.leadIn: a person who carries on a business—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: which involves handling of any article intended to be carried into an aerodrome for any purpose;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: which involves provision of service by personnel who have access to a restricted area;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: which, in the opinion of the Authority, otherwise impinges on the security of an aerodrome.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may by notice in writing require—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the manager of an aerodrome to submit a security programme which applies to the aerodrome;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person referred to in subsection (2) to submit a security programme which applies in relation to him,

subsection.continued: in accordance with the requirement in the notice.

subsection.content: Where a notice is served under subsection (3) on a person, he shall submit the relevant security programme within such period as may be specified in the notice.

Where a security programme is submitted by a person under subsection (4), the Authority may by notice in writing require the person to amend the security programme in such manner as the Authority may specify in that notice.
Where a notice is served under subsection (5) on a person, he shall amend the relevant security programme in such manner and within such period as may be specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: The period specified in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice served under subsection (3) shall not be less than 42 days after the day on which the notice is served;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a notice served under subsection (5) shall not be less than 21 days after the day on which the notice is served.

subsection.leadIn: The person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who submits a security programme under subsection (4); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who amends a security programme under subsection (6),

subsection.continued: shall bear the costs of the preparation or amendment, as the case may be, of the security programme.

subsection.content: Any person who without reasonable excuse contravenes subsection (4) or (6) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6.
The Authority may, with the advice of the Committee, amend the Programme.

The Authority may, for the purpose of implementation of the Programme, issue a security direction to any person to whom subsection (3) applies requiring him to take such measures as are specified in the direction.
Where the Authority intends to issue a security direction, he may seek the Committee’s advice on the proposed direction before issuing it.

subsection.leadIn: This subsection applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Airport Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the manager of an aerodrome other than an aerodrome which is principally used by aircraft in military service;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any operator of an aircraft registered or operating in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any person who occupies any land forming part of an aerodrome;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any person who is permitted to have access to a restricted area in an aerodrome for the purposes of the activities of a business carried on by him;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any person who manages navigational or other aviation related facilities that are important to the continued operation of international civil aviation;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: any person who carries on a business—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: which involves handling of any article intended to be carried into an aerodrome for any purpose;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which involves provision of service by personnels who have access to a restricted area;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: which, in the opinion of the Authority, otherwise impinges on the security of an aerodrome.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, by a security direction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: revoke wholly or partly another security direction issued previously;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: modify another security direction issued previously in such manner as he thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who without reasonable excuse fails to comply with the requirements of a security direction issued to him commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 3;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

subsection.content: Where a person is convicted of an offence under subsection (5)(a), then, if without reasonable excuse the failure in respect of which he was convicted is continued after the conviction, he shall be guilty of a further offence and liable on conviction to a fine not exceeding $1,000 for each day on which such further offence continues.
A security direction shall be issued in writing.

subsection.leadIn: A security direction may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be either of a general or of a specific character;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require any measure to be taken, or require any person not to cause or permit anything to be done, at such time and during such period as may be specified in the direction;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: require different measures be taken in relation to different kinds or level of threat specified in the direction;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: specify—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the minimum number of persons to be employed for the purposes of implementing any measures required to be taken by the person to whom it is issued;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the manner in which persons employed for such purposes are to be deployed; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the qualifications which persons employed for such purposes are to have;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: specify any apparatus, equipment or other aids to be used for such purposes.

subsection.content: A security direction to any person not to cause or permit anything to be done shall be construed as requiring him to take all such steps as in any particular circumstances are practicable and necessary to prevent that thing from being done.

A security direction may be issued to a person appearing to the Authority to be about to become a person to whom section 28(3) applies, but a security direction issued to a person by virtue of this subsection shall not take effect until he becomes such a person, and, in relation to a security direction so issued, the preceding provisions of this section shall apply with the necessary modifications.

subsection.leadIn: If it appears to the Authority that an exception should be made to a security direction or any part or provision thereof as a matter of urgency in any particular case he may, by a notification given otherwise than in writing to the person for the time being subject to the direction, authorize that person to disregard the requirements of the direction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to such—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: aircraft or class of aircraft;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: aerodrome or part of an aerodrome;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: land outside an aerodrome;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: property;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: activity; or

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on such occasion; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for such period,

subsection.continued: as he may specify, and the security direction shall have effect in relation to such person in that case subject to any such exception.

subsection.leadIn: Any notification given to any person under subsection (1) with respect to any security direction shall cease to have effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if a security direction is subsequently issued under section 28(4) to that person revoking or modifying the original security direction, from the date on which the new security direction becomes effective; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if no such new direction is issued within the period of 30 days after the day on which the notification is given, upon the expiry of that period.

subsection.leadIn: Any notification given to any person under subsection (1) shall be regarded to have been given if it is communicated by whatever means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of an individual, to that individual;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a body corporate, to any director or the chief executive officer or secretary or other similar officer of the body corporate;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of a partnership, to any partner of the partnership in accordance with paragraph (a) or (b), as the case may be.

subsection.leadIn: A person to whom a security direction is issued may serve on the Authority a notice in writing objecting to the direction, on the grounds that the measures specified in the direction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: are unnecessary and should be dispensed with; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: are excessively onerous or inconvenient and should be modified.

subsection.leadIn: Where the person to whom a security direction is issued serves a notice under subsection (1) objecting to the direction, the Authority shall consider the grounds of the objection and, if so requested by the objector, shall afford to him a reasonable opportunity of appearing before and being heard by a public officer appointed by the Authority for this purpose, who shall then decide on the objection by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: confirming the direction as originally issued;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: confirming the direction subject to one or more modifications specified in the notice served under subsection (3); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: withdrawing the direction.

subsection.content: A decision under subsection (2) shall be notified to the objector by the Authority by a notice in writing.

A person who objects under section 31(1) and is aggrieved by a decision of the Authority made under section 31(2)(a) or (b) in respect of him may, within 28 days after the receipt of the notification of the decision, appeal to the Chief Secretary for Administration by lodging a notice of appeal with the Chief Secretary for Administration.
On an appeal under subsection (1) against a decision of the Authority, the Chief Secretary for Administration may confirm, vary or revoke the decision.
An appeal under subsection (1) shall not affect the operation of the security direction in respect of which the appeal is brought.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Purposes to which this Part applies
section.leadIn: The purposes to which this Part applies are the protection against acts of violence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of aircraft, and of persons or property on board aircraft;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: of aerodromes, and of such persons or property as (in the case of persons) are present in any part of an aerodrome or (in the case of property) forms part of an aerodrome or is in any part of an aerodrome; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: of air navigation installations which do not form part of an aerodrome.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Power for the Authority to require information

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, by notice in writing given to any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is the operator of one or more aircraft registered or operating in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is the manager of an aerodrome;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: occupies any land forming part of an aerodrome; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is permitted to have access to a restricted area in an aerodrome for the purposes of the business carried on by him,

subsection.continued: require that person to provide the Authority with such information specified in the notice as the Authority may require in connection with the exercise by the Authority of his functions under this Part or any incident which impinges on aviation security.

subsection.content: A notice under subsection (1) shall specify a date (not being earlier than 7 days after the day on which the notice is served) before which the information required by the notice in accordance with subsection (1) is to be furnished to the Authority.

Any such notice may also require the person to whom it is given, after he has furnished to the Authority the information required by the notice in accordance with subsection (1), to inform the Authority if at any time the information previously furnished to the Authority (including any information furnished in pursuance of a requirement imposed by virtue of this subsection) is rendered inaccurate by any change of circumstances (including the taking of any further measures for purposes to which this Part applies or the alteration or discontinuance of any measures already being taken).

In so far as such a notice requires further information to be furnished to the Authority in accordance with subsection (3), it shall require that information to be furnished to him before the end of such period not being less than 7 days after the day on which the change of circumstances occurs as is specified in the notice for the purposes of this subsection.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement imposed on him by a notice under this section; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in furnishing any information so required, makes a statement which he knows to be false or misleading in a material particular, or recklessly makes a statement which is false or misleading in a material particular,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 3;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

subsection.leadIn: A notice given to a person under subsection (1) may at any time—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be revoked by a notice in writing given to him by the Authority; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be varied by a further notice under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may by notice in the Gazette designate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the whole or any part of any aerodrome; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any part of the sea adjacent to any aerodrome,

subsection.continued: to be a restricted area.

subsection.leadIn: Before designating a restricted area under subsection (1), the Authority shall consult—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the manager of the relevant aerodrome; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (where the relevant aerodrome includes an air navigation installation) the authority responsible for the air navigation installation.

subsection.content: The whole or any part of an aerodrome may be designated under subsection (1) as a restricted area for specified days or times of days only.
A designation under subsection (1) shall not come into effect before the date on which the relevant notice is published in the Gazette.

In relation to an air navigation installation in Hong Kong which does not form part of an aerodrome, this section has effect as if any reference to an aerodrome were a reference to such an air navigation installation and any reference to the manager of an aerodrome were a reference to the authority responsible for such an air navigation installation.

subsection.leadIn: Where the whole or any part of an aerodrome has been designated under this section as a restricted area—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subsections (1) to (5) also have effect in relation to any variation of the designation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the designation may be revoked by the Authority by notice in the Gazette.

subsection.content: The Authority may, for the purposes to which this Part applies, by order prohibit any person, aircraft, vehicle or vessel from entering or staying in such part of the restricted area or any land or water adjacent thereto as he may specify by reference to a map or otherwise.
Subject to subsection (5), an order made under subsection (1) shall be published in the Gazette.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (5), an order made under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall not be effective prior to its publication in the Gazette;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may be effective for a definite or indefinite period.

subsection.content: An order made under subsection (1) is not subsidiary legislation.

subsection.leadIn: Where in the opinion of the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an emergency exists; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: publication of an order under subsection (2) will occasion unreasonable delay,

subsection.continued: he may direct that an order shall become effective immediately or at such other time as he may specify notwithstanding that subsection (2) has not been complied with in relation to the order.

subsection.content: Where a direction is given under subsection (5), the Authority shall publish the order in such manner as he thinks fit.

Any person who, without reasonable excuse, enters or remains in the restricted area or any land or sea adjacent thereto in contravention of an order made under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 1 year.

Any authorized officer or police officer may remove, by force if necessary, any person, aircraft, vehicle or vessel found in the restricted area or any land or water adjacent thereto in contravention of an order made under subsection (1).

section.name: s37
section.heading: Power to impose restrictions in relation to aircraft

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes to which this Part applies the Authority may give a direction to the operator of an aircraft registered or operating in Hong Kong, or to the manager of any aerodrome, requiring him—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not to cause or permit persons or property to go or be taken on board any aircraft to which the direction relates, or to come or be brought into proximity to any such aircraft, unless such searches of those persons or that property as are specified in the direction have been carried out; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not to cause or permit any such aircraft to fly unless such searches of the aircraft as are specified in the direction have been carried out.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), the Authority may give a direction in writing to the operator of an aircraft registered or operating in Hong Kong requiring him not to cause or permit the aircraft to fly unless such modifications or alterations of the aircraft, or of apparatus or equipment installed in the aircraft, as are specified in the direction have first been carried out, or such additional apparatus or equipment as is so specified is first installed in the aircraft.

Before giving any direction under subsection (2), the Authority shall inform the Director of the modifications, alterations or additional apparatus or equipment proposed to be required, and shall take account of any advice given to him by the Director with respect to those proposals.

In giving any direction under subsection (2), the Authority shall allow, and shall specify in the direction, such period as appears to him to be reasonably required for carrying out the modifications or alterations or installing the additional apparatus or equipment in question; and the direction shall not take effect before the end of the period so specified.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to the following provisions of this Part, a direction given to an operator of aircraft under subsection (1) may be given so as to relate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: either to all the aircraft registered or operating in Hong Kong of which at the time when the direction is given or at any subsequent time he is the operator or only to one or more such aircraft, or to a class of such aircraft, specified in the direction;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: either to all persons or only to one or more persons, or persons of one or more descriptions, specified in the direction; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: either to property of every description or only to particular property, or property of one or more descriptions, specified in the direction,

subsection.continued: and a direction given to an operator of aircraft under subsection (2) may be given so as to relate either to all the aircraft registered or operating in Hong Kong of which at the time when the direction is given or at any subsequent time he is the operator or only to one or more such aircraft, or to a class of such aircraft, specified in the direction.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to the following provisions of this Part, a direction given to the manager of an aerodrome under subsection (1) may be given so as to relate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: either to all aircraft which at the time when the direction is given or at any subsequent time are in any part of the aerodrome, or to a class of such aircraft specified in the direction;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: either to all persons or only to one or more persons, or persons of one or more descriptions, specified in the direction; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: either to property of every description or only to particular property, or property of one or more descriptions, specified in the direction.

subsection.content: Subject to the following provisions of this Part, any direction given under this section to any person not to cause or permit anything to be done shall be construed as requiring him to take all such steps as in any particular circumstances are practicable and necessary to prevent that thing from being done.

subsection.leadIn: A direction may be given under this section to a person appearing to the Authority to be about to become—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: such an operator as is mentioned in subsection (1) or (2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such a manager as is mentioned in subsection (1),

subsection.continued: but a direction given to a person by virtue of this subsection shall not take effect until he becomes such an operator or manager, and in relation to a direction so given, the preceding provisions of this section shall apply with the necessary modifications.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a direction given to him under this section commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 3;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

subsection.content: Where a person is convicted of an offence under subsection (9), then, if without reasonable excuse the failure in respect of which he was convicted is continued after the conviction, he shall be guilty of a further offence and liable on conviction to a fine not exceeding $1,000 for each day on which such further offence continues.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Power to require searches at aerodrome

subsection.content: For the purposes to which this Part applies, the Authority may give a direction to the manager of any aerodrome requiring him to use his best endeavours to ensure that such searches to which this section applies as are specified in the direction are carried out.

subsection.leadIn: The searches to which this section applies, in relation to an aerodrome, are searches—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of the aerodrome or any part of it;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: of any aircraft which at the time when the direction is given or at any subsequent times is in any part of the aerodrome; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: of persons or property (other than aircraft) which may at any such time be in any part of the aerodrome.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to section 13, where a direction given under this section to the manager of an aerodrome is for the time being in force, then if any person specified in the direction in accordance with this section has reasonable ground to suspect that a restricted article is in, or may be brought into, any part of the aerodrome, he may, by virtue of this subsection and without a warrant, search any part of the aerodrome or any aircraft, vehicle, goods or other movable property of any description which, or any person who, is for the time being in any part of the aerodrome, and for that purpose—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may enter any building or works in the aerodrome, or enter upon any land in the aerodrome, if necessary by force; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may stop any such aircraft, vehicle, goods, property or person and detain it or him for so long as may be necessary for that purpose.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse fails to comply with a direction given to him under this section; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: wilfully obstructs a person acting in the exercise of a power conferred on him by subsection (3),

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 3;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 year.

subsection.content: Where a person is convicted of an offence under subsection (4)(a), then, if without reasonable excuse the failure in respect of which he was convicted is continued after the conviction, he shall be guilty of a further offence and liable on conviction to a fine of $1,000 for each day on which such further offence continues.
Subsection (3) has effect without prejudice to the operation, in relation to any offence under this Ordinance, of any law relating to the power to arrest with or without warrant.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Power to require other persons to conduct searches

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes to which this Part applies, the Authority may give a direction to any person (other than the manager of an aerodrome) who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: occupies any land forming part of an aerodrome; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is permitted to have access to a restricted area in an aerodrome for the purposes of the business carried on by him,

subsection.continued: requiring him to use his best endeavours to secure that such searches to which this section applies as are specified in the direction are carried out.

subsection.leadIn: The searches to which this section applies are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a person falling within subsection (1)(a), searches—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: of the land which he occupies within the aerodrome; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: of persons or property which is on that land; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a person falling within subsection (1)(b), searches—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: of any land which he occupies outside the aerodrome for the purposes of his business; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: of persons or property which is on that land.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a direction given to him under this section commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 3;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

subsection.content: Where a person is convicted of an offence under subsection (3), then, if without reasonable excuse the failure in respect of which he was convicted is continued after the conviction, he shall be guilty of a further offence and liable on conviction to a fine not exceeding $1,000 for each day on which such further offence continues.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Matters which may be included in directions under sections 38 and 39
section.leadIn: A direction under section 38(1) or 39(1) may specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the minimum number of persons by whom any search to which the direction relates is to be carried out;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the qualifications which persons carrying out any such search are to have;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the manner in which any such search is to be carried out; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any apparatus, equipment or other aids to be used for the purpose of carrying out any such search.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Certain works must be to the satisfaction of the Authority

subsection.leadIn: No person shall undertake any work relating to the construction, installation or alteration of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any equipment or facilities in any part of an aerodrome specified by the Authority; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any air navigation installation,

subsection.continued: unless the provisions of Programme are complied with to the satisfaction of the Authority in relation to such equipment, facilities or installation.
